title: Introduction to JavaScript
content: JavaScript is a versatile programming language used for web development.

title: Variables and Data Types
content: JavaScript supports various data types including strings, numbers, and objects.

title: Functions
content: Functions are reusable blocks of code that perform a specific task.

title: Control Structures
content: JavaScript uses control structures like loops and conditionals to control the flow of execution.

title: Events
content: JavaScript can respond to user interactions through events like clicks and key presses.

title: Objects and Arrays
content: JavaScript uses objects and arrays to store collections of data.

title: Asynchronous JavaScript
content: JavaScript supports asynchronous programming through callbacks, promises, and async/await.

title: Error Handling
content: JavaScript provides mechanisms for handling errors using try/catch blocks.

title: APIs and AJAX
content: JavaScript can interact with APIs and perform asynchronous requests using AJAX.

title: ES6 Features
content: JavaScript ES6 introduced new features like arrow functions, template literals, and destructuring.

title: JavaScript Frameworks
content: Popular JavaScript frameworks like React, Angular, and Vue.js help build complex applications.

title: Debugging and Testing
content: JavaScript provides tools for debugging and testing code to ensure quality and performance.

title: JavaScript in the Browser
content: JavaScript runs in the browser, allowing for dynamic and interactive web pages.

title: JavaScript and the Server
content: JavaScript can also run on the server using Node.js, enabling full-stack development.

title: JavaScript and Databases
content: JavaScript can interact with databases using libraries like Mongoose for MongoDB.

title: JavaScript and Web APIs
content: JavaScript can access web APIs to fetch data and perform operations on the web.

title: DOM Manipulation
content: JavaScript can manipulate the Document Object Model (DOM) to change the content and structure of web pages.
